title: BBC Local Live: Sheffield and South Yorkshire on Thursday 10 March 2016 - BBC News
summary: rother valley mp kevin barron quits standards role over allegations .
look north 's harry gration and paul hudson start sport relief challenge in south yorkshire .
doncaster man charged with attempted murder after stabbing attack .
devolution : worksop and retford recommended to join sheffield city region .

documents.title: good evening : your live coverage across the day
text: thanks for joining us today .
we 're back from 08:00 tomorrow with more updates .
today belongs to three-legged wonders , harry and paul .
they 're in barnsley after completing more than 15 miles in around nine hours on the first day of their 3 counties 3 legs sport relief challenge .
full update on bbc look north tonight at 18:30 .
as paul says

thanks for your lovely messages on our facebook page .
i guess there might be three sore legs in the morning !

good luck . ''
best of luck to you two . ''

waiting for you in barnsley . ''

BBC Sheffield, Local Live

documents.title: 'illness made me stronger ' says wednesday 's hutchinson
text: sheffield wednesday defender sam hutchinson ( left below ) has said that dealing with depression has made him stronger .
hutchinson 's early career was blighted by injury , forcing him to retire aged 21 in 2010 , before he returned a year later .
`` i 'm probably the happiest i 've ever been now , with my kids , '' he told bbc radio sheffield .

documents.title: mp for don valley criticises authority for 'failing ' to act sooner over energy bills
text: don valley mp caroline flint has criticised the competition & markets authority for failing to act sooner on the evidence of its own report and protect the majority of energy consumers who it states have been overcharged by at least £ 7.6bn over four years .
the cma has today set out proposals to reform the energy market , open up competition and help customers get a better deal .
the proposals are designed to reform the energy market and increase competition to help consumers save money .
the cma also proposed :
author: Jenny Cork
BBC Sheffield, Local Live

documents.title: school report day in south yorkshire
text: today has been school report day .
news school report gives thousands of 11-16 year-old students across the uk the opportunity to research and produce their own news reports for a real audience .
i 've been to see students at maltby academy , who were taking part in bbc school report .
school reporters are filming and editing their stories .
author: Mark Ansell
BBC Look North reporter

documents.title: missing : appeal to find 15-year-old georgina from doncaster
text: police are asking for your help to find missing 15-year-old georgina kuhnel from doncaster .
georgina was last seen at around 16:00 yesterday in the st mary 's road area of doncaster and police say concerns are growing for her welfare .
she is described as being around 5ft 2in , with long dark brown hair .
she was last seen wearing a brown coat and black leggings .
please call 101 quoting missing person reference ax/1338/2016 .

documents.title: your messages of support : bbc look north 's harry and paul in sport relief challenge
text: look north presenters harry gration and paul hudson are on the final strait of their first day of their gruelling three-legged challenge for sport relief .
they 're walking 120 miles across south , west and north yorkshire over nine days - tied together at the ankles throughout .
and they 're very grateful for the messages of support they 've received throughout day one
good luck to @ twitterid and @ twitterid in barnsley east today doing @ twitterid for # sportrelief # barnsleyisbrill

documents.title: 'i followed rules in registering the interest ' , says mp for rother valley
text: sir kevin barron has referred himself to the independent parliamentary standards commissioner kathryn hudson after the daily telegraph reported that he received fees for sponsoring dinners and a breakfast on the parliamentary estate .
in a letter to ms hudson , the labour mp said he had done nothing wrong as the money was donated to charity .
it is a matter of record that i followed the rules in registering this interest and that i deposited an agreement for the provision of services , as the rules required . ''
a spokeswoman for the cross-party standards committee said sir kevin was standing aside from its work `` until the matter is resolved '' .
author: BBC Politics

documents.title: listen : doncaster rovers ' manager with team news
text: doncaster boss darren ferguson says support from the board has been `` fantastic ''
author: Jonathan Buchan
BBC Radio Sheffield Sport

documents.title: rother valley mp sir kevin barron quits standards role over allegations
text: labour mp for rother valley , sir kevin barron , has stood aside as commons standards committee chairman over allegations he hosted events at westminster for a drugs firm .
sir kevin has referred himself to the parliamentary commissioner for standards , kathryn hudson .
it follows a daily telegraph report saying he received fees for sponsoring dinners and a breakfast on the parliamentary estate .

my own understanding is that due to the fact that i made no personal gain and all the fees were paid to a charity , i had not breached the rules on usage of parliamentary facilities for personal or business use .
it is a matter of record that i followed the rules in registering this interest and that i deposited an agreement for the provision of services , as the rules required .

in light of the allegations that i may have breached house of commons code of conduct or rules , i refer myself to you for you to consider whether any breaches of the rules or the code of conduct have taken place . ''
author: BBC Politics

documents.title: breakingmp sir kevin barron quits standards role over allegations
text: labour mp sir kevin barron says he standing aside as commons standards committee chairman over allegations that he agreed to host events for a drugs firm .
sir kevin has referred himself to the parliamentary commissioner for standards .
author: Oliver Wright
BBC News Online, Yorkshire

documents.title: canaries left to 'a horrible slow death ' being cared for by south yorkshire rspca
text: the rspca in south yorkshire is looking after more than a dozen canaries which were left for dead in a sealed cardboard box at a roadside .
they had no food or water and were dumped in north nottinghamshire at papplewick .
animal welfare officer karen brannan said : `` no food , water or air holes could have left them to die a horrible slow death . ''
author: Mick Lunney
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: golden retriever from rotherham up for 'dog hero ' award at crufts
text: boy 's best friend
azerley belongs to cohen hadfield from kilnhurst .
cohen has autism and azerley has helped him so much that he 's in the running for a 'dog hero ' award at crufts .
good luck azerley !
the winner will be announced on sunday on the final day of crufts .
author: Jenny Cork
BBC Sheffield, Local Live

documents.title: welcome to bbc school report 2016
text: today is bbc school report day .
the idea is to give 11-16 year-old students the chance to make their own news reports for a real audience .
this is 10th year it has been held .
last year , more than 1,000 schools across the uk took part in this diversity award-winning project .
schools across south yorkshire are taking part .
find out more here .
author: BBC School Report

documents.title: harry and paul 3 counties 3 legs challenge heads to worsbrough
text: crowds gathering at worsbrough mill museum to see harry & paul @ twitterid i 'm following them for @ twitterid
author: BBC Look North, Yorkshire

documents.title: rotherham 'top dog ' up for crufts award for helping autistic boy
text: friend for life
this golden retriever from rotherham 's up for an award at crufts this week .
he 's called `` azerley '' and he belongs to cohen hadfield from kilnhurst .
cohen has autism and azerley 's helped him come out of his shell , so much so that he 's in the running for a dog hero award at crufts , to be announced this sunday .
author: Jenny Cork
BBC Sheffield, Local Live

documents.title: university of sheffield among best in europe
text: the university of sheffield is among the best in europe , according to a new league table .
author: Sheffield Star

documents.title: commute time 'should be no longer than an hour in the north '
text: nobody in the north should have to commute more than an hour , according to a new report published today by ippr north .
it says newly-elected mayors in cities like sheffield should focus on transport and the time it takes to get between major towns and cities .
author: Jenny Cork
BBC Sheffield, Local Live

documents.title: sheffield boxer kid galahad free to box at end of month thanks to doping ban cut
text: sheffield boxer kid galahad has had his doping ban cut by six months , leaving him free to resume his career this month .
the wincobank super bantamweight was banned for 18 months after testing positive for a steroid in september 2014 .
he claimed his brother had spiked spiking his protein supplement after an argument .
more on bbc look north at 13:30
author: Shamir Masri
BBC Look North

documents.title: harry and paul on the first part of their 3 legged challenge in south yorkshire
text: they 're definitely on their way !
paul and harry on their three-legged sport relief challenge .
they left rotherham this morning and already have collected more than £ 1,000 from supporters who have joined them on the journey so far
more on bbc look north at 13:30 .
author: BBC Look North, Yorkshire

documents.title: sheffield medals hoard makes £ 55,000
text: the first half of a sale of 1,000 military medals - one of the biggest auctions of its kind sheffield has ever seen - made £ 55,000 and attracted 'huge ' interest from collectors .
the hoard was amassed by an enthusiast who lived in the city
author: Sheffield Star

documents.title: radio sheffield presenter celebrated in blogspot
text: on work love follow , our morning presenter rony robinson is described as the wordsmith .
that 's true enough with 32 years of broadcasting and numerous publications under his belt !
the blog celebrates people across the region who are following their passion .
there 's an extract below this wonderful by the author of the piece , john anderson .
rony robinson is a prolific writer and bbc radio presenter .
he has written over 100 plays , numerous books and he is one of the bbc 's longest serving presenters .
as we chatted through the idea of this article it became apparent that i could n't limit rony to being defined as a writer or as a presenter but ''
read more here .
author: BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: the elections are looming : make sure you have your say
text: it may be a couple of months until may , but if you want to vote in the forthcoming elections then you need to register by monday 18 april to take part , the electoral commission says .
to register to vote you can visit the following website :
and , if you 're unsure as to whether you 're registered or not , or want to find out more about voting and taking part in the elections , then you can visit the voter information website here :
author: Jenny Cork
BBC Sheffield, Local Live

documents.title: not sure how to eat your worms ? get yourself up to norton , sheffield
text: i love taking your calls on bbc radio sheffield breakfast show .
especially when you give us updates about the flora and fauna across south yorkshire .
it 's like springwatch on your radio .
special thanks to dave in norton who gave us some enlightening information about what thrushes do with their worms in s8
i you have any updates on birds bread-crumbing their worms or mucky-eating pigeons .
give me a call .
every weekday morning 0114 279 66 99
author: Toby Foster
Presenter, BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: junior doctors strike : are patients losing patience ?
text: we 're more or less in the middle of the 48-hour doctors ' strike .
the patients association have come out and said `` the failure to resolve the differences is bad for doctors , bad for the taxpayer , but above all bad for patients and the nhs '' .
but are patients at at the royal hallamshire hospital in sheffield losing patience with striking junior doctors ?
author: Everard Davy
BBC Radio Sheffield News

documents.title: your views : junior doctors ' strike enters its second day
text: the strike by junior doctors has entered its second day .
it ends at 08:00 tomorrow .
nhs england says there might be particular problems today with patients ready to go home , but having to stay in hospital because there are no junior doctors to discharge them .
freya 's a junior doctor at the royal hallamshire hospital in sheffield .
yesterday , she said it was n't the rain that 's made her disappointed to be striking again
you 've been sharing your views on this on our facebook page
tell your union to get on and make a deal . ''
great people who have my support . ''
you 've got my support ! ''
author: Jenny Cork
BBC Sheffield, Local Live

text: look north presenter harry gration and i are walking 120 hilly miles across yorkshire over nine days - tied together throughout .
here 's where we 're going
hope to see you along the way !
author: Paul Hudson
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: doncaster man charged with attempted murder
text: a 66-year-old man has been charged with attempted murder and production of cannabis following an incident in the manor road area of doncaster earlier this week .
arthur richard jepson , of harlington , appeared before doncaster magistrates ' court yesterday .
he was remanded in custody to appear before sheffield crown court on thursday 7 april .
a 41-year-old man suffered multiple stab injuries and was taken to hospital , where he remains in a stable condition .
author: Nick Wilson
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: rotherham autism assistance dog in line for top crufts award
text: boy 's best friend
an autism assistance dog from rotherham is in the running for a dog hero award at crufts this weekend .
azerley the golden retriever cross has helped stop seven-year-old cohen shutting himself off in his own world .
the much-loved pet has been shortlisted for a friends for life award which gets announced on sunday on the final day of the competition .
author: Jenny Cork
BBC Sheffield, Local Live

documents.title: weather : grey and cloudy this morning getting better this afternoon
text: cloudy with further outbreaks of rain , becoming light and patchy .
minimum temperature 2c ( 36f )
author: Alina Jenkins
BBC Weather

documents.title: good morning : join us for today 's live coverage
text: thanks for joining us for live updates from across south yorkshire until 18:00 today .
if you 've got a story , get in touch .
another grey day in the region - full weather report coming shortly .
but never mind the dull skies , it 's a big day for look north 's harry gration and paul hudson as they start their sport relief challenge .
they 've been in training for a nine-day trek around yorkshire .
they 're leaving from rotherham at 08:30 this morning and heading towards barnsley .
best foot forward lads !
why not join them along the route and say hi !
author: Jenny Cork
BBC Sheffield, Local Live
